A course for every interest

The base of our program is our Mindfullness + Brain Building course. After building up creativity, reasoning, and problem solving skills, students can enroll in coding, game design, web development, and IT courses.

  Our courses are always available to students at no cost.

Mindfulness  + Brain Building

This required foundational course leverages mindfulness training and engaging puzzles to improve creativity, concentration, memory, core mathematical reasoning & problem solving skills.
Available @
SLCC, Meadowbrook University of Utah
Request info

Introduction to coding

This course provides an introduction to computer science via the Code.org curriculum and leverages a user-friendly graphical programming language catering to students being introduced to programming.
Available @
SLCC, Meadowbrook
Request info

Video Game Design

This is a two part project-based course. Part one is designed to provide technical proficiency in industry standard animation and game design software resulting in a portfolio of games. Students will gain exposure to artificial intelligence, augmented & virtual reality as well as advanced physics and math concepts. Part two focuses on preparing for certifications in key software used for students seeking additional employment credentials.
Available @
SLCC, Meadowbrook University of Utah
Request info

Web Development

This project-based course guides students through a sequence of website and web application creation using industry standard tools, design concepts and programming languages. Successful students will have a solid foundation from which to enter an intensive coding boot camp, build websites and apps as an entrepreneur or leverage on college applications.
Available @
SLCC, Meadowbrook University of Utah
Request info

Information Technology Careers

This course covers both computer hardware and software topics as laid out in the industry standard CompTIA A+ certification curriculum. It includes both classroom and laboratory components. Students who complete this course will be prepared to take the A+ certification exam. Successful students will be highly employable as an IT Helpdesk or Jr. Systems Administrator.
Available @
SLCC, Meadowbrook University of Utah
Request info

Want to help?

We welcome all volunteers. Our program simply wouldn’t work without them. 

We especially love guest speakers.

Request info
We are a public-private partnership designed to enhance tech related job, entrepreneurial and educational opportunities for refugees and other underrepresented communities in Utah.

Partners

  • Presented by
  • Implementation partners
  • Government
  • Donating
  • Fiscal
    sponsors

We leverage skill-based volunteerism as well as targeted in-kind and financial donations to provide free training and tech certification pathways for qualified applicants who otherwise would not have access to these opportunities.

We target individuals with demonstrated financial need, interest in tech fields, a strong desire for self-improvement and a history of community engagement.

Our methodology centers around using infographic materials to distill information; facilitated group dialogue; and hands-on projects that nurture the inherent curiosity, self-confidence, communication and teamwork skills of participants.
